target_text: "OK, great. Software quality is the end result. It has a structural perspective which is the code and the design. It has also an external component which is free of defects and meets the end user requirements."

Role.Subject: Anthropology
Role.positionality: As a software developer pursuing a Master's in Anthropology with a focus on Economics, my background shapes my research goals to explore the intersection of technology and societal structures. I aim to understand how economic systems influence cultural practices and vice versa. However, I recognize my biases stemming from ethical and societal assumptions inherent in my technical background, which may color my interpretations of anthropological data. This positionality compels me to critically examine how my experiences and perspectives influence my analysis, ensuring that I remain aware of the complexities within the subjects I study and strive for a more nuanced understanding of the human experience.

codebook.justification: The phrase [Software quality is the end result] highlights the subjective nature of quality, which varies based on user expectations and context.

The term [structural perspective which is the code and the design] emphasizes the importance of design and architecture in assessing software quality, reflecting a subjective interpretation of what constitutes 'structure.'
The phrase [meets the end user requirements] indicates that quality is contingent upon user satisfaction, which is inherently subjective and varies across different user groups.
